Class FieldList

  • java.lang.Object
    • FieldList

  • public class FieldList
extends java.lang.Object
    List of Field objects to encapsulate implementation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int availableID
      Counter for generating unique field IDs.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Field> fields
      Core list of Field objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Construct from .pond header line.

    • Field Detail

      • fields

        private java.util.ArrayList<Field> fields
        Core list of Field objects.

      • availableID

        private int availableID
        Counter for generating unique field IDs.

        Should be increased by one each time to ensure uniqueness, and likewise never decreased.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FieldList

        public FieldList(java.lang.String header)
        Construct from .pond header line.

        Due to .tsv standard, only single line may be header (ie. not data)

        Parameters:
        header - Tab-separated list of Field names and type prefixes

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Counts number of Field objects in the list.
        Returns:
        fields.size()

      • getField

        public Field getField(int index)
        Gets the Field at the specified index location.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the field to retrieve
        Returns:
        The requested Field

      • addField

        public void addField(int index,
            Field f)
        Insert the given field at the specified index location.

        Set Field.id from availableID if necessary.

        Parameters:
        index - The index location to insert f
        f - The field to add

      • removeField

        public Field removeField(int index)
        Removes the Field at the specified index location.

        Don't reset Field.id as that should remain the same if ever restored to correctly link back with Entry data. While this would technically be bad behavior, we need to have some way to ensure proper association.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of the field to remove
        Returns:
        The removed field to facilitate eg. undo
